description: Erection of a temporary community centre (Use Class F2(b)), community garden, parking, and refuse storage, for use of a period of up to 10 years.
decision_conditions: 1- Commencement within three yearsThe development hereby permitted must be begun not later than three years after the date of this permission.REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended.

2- Temporary UseThe uses of the site hereby permitted shall be operated for a limited period only until ten years from the date of this permission, on or before which date the use shall be discontinued and all the buildings and structures hereby approved removed from the site and reused or recycled.REASON: To ensure the site becomes available for a permanent development.

3- Development in accordance with plansThe development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

4- Landscaping and Public Realm Design  The landscaping scheme shown in the documents hereby approved shall be carried out within a period of six months from the date on which the development of the site commences or shall be carried out in the first planting (and seeding) season following commencement of the development, and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for the lifetime of the development, such maintenance to include the replacement of any plants that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed.REASON: To enhance the character, appearance and ecology of the development and contribution to green infrastructure.

5- Air Source Heat PumpsPrior to the occupation of the development details that the proposed heat pumps comply with the minimum performance standards as set out in the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECA) product criteria for the relevant ASHP technology as well as evidence that the heat pumps comply with other relevant issues as outlined in the Microgeneration Certification Scheme Heat Pump Product Certification and the Seasonal Coefficient of Performance (SCOP), the Seasonal Performance Factor (SFP) and Seasonal Energy Efficiency ratio (SEER) are not worse than the coefficients indicated in the energy assessment, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details thus approved.REASON: To ensure that the systems adopted are low carbon and the development contributes towards local, regional and national commitments to a net-zero carbon emission future.

6- Operational ManagementThe operation of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the ‘Management Arrangements for the Nightingale temporary community hall’ document hereby approved.REASON: The proposed use has the potential to cause noise nuisance and the mitigation measures outlined in the named document would ensure any such amenity impacts on residential neighbours are not significant.

7- Sustainable Urban Drainage Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving, etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration testmust be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.REASON: To safeguard against flooding and pollution and to reduce waste.

8- Tree Protection The development, including works of construction, shall be carried out in accordance with the Arboricultural Report hereby approved.REASON: To safeguard and protect neighbouring trees.

9- Bird and Bat Boxes and Insect HabitatsAt least three bird and bat bricks/boxes will be installed at eaves level, or on neighbouring trees, as part of the development, along with at least three ecology poles, as per the ‘Design and Access Statement’ hereby approved, prior to occupation of the development. The boxes/bricks and ecology poles shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development.REASON: To provide potential habitat for local wildlife, in line with the recommendations of the submitted habitat surve

10- Non-Road Mobile MachineryAll Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37 kW and up to and including 560 kW used during the course of site preparation, demolition and construction phases shall comply with the emissions standards of the Mayor of London's NRMM Low Emission Zone for the Central Activities Zone and Opportunity Areas. Unless in compliance with these standards, no NRMM shall be on-site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The applicant shall keep an up-to-date register of all NRMM used during site preparation, demolition and construction phases on the online register at https://www.london.gov.uk/programmes-and-strategies/environment-and-climate-change/pollution-and-air-quality/nrmmREASON: To comply with London Plan Policy SI 1 and to ensure emissions from the site during the construction phase are acceptable with regard to public health and amenity.

11- Circular EconomyThe reuse and recycling of materials shall be carried out in accordance with the “Nightingale Estate - Temporary Community Centre Circular Economy Framework” hereby approved unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Planning Authority.REASON: To ensure that the temporary nature of the proposed development does not lead to unacceptable impacts in relation to Hackney’s 2030 deadline for Net Zero.

12- PV PanelsDetails of photovoltaic panels to be provided on the roof of the community centre shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details thus approved.REASON: The building is proposed to be in situ for ten years and details of PV panel reuse at the end of life of the building have been submitted by the applicant. The condition ensures that an opportunity to increase the sustainability of the building is not missed.

13- Details of waste storeNotwithstanding the details shown on the plans hereby approved, prior to thecommencement of above ground works details of the bin/waste storage building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The details submitted shall include but not be limited to:Scale plan and elevation drawings (1:100)Material detailsPrecedent photographs.The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details thus approved.REASON: To ensure the waste store is of a suitable scale, materiality and standard of external appearance.
